data.title: Mangalore and Udupi Diocese level ‘Fr. Mathew Vas Memorial Inter-Parish Tournament and Excellence in Sports Awards 2023′
data.text:
Mangaluru: The Fr. Mathew Vas Memorial Inter-Parish Football and Throw Ball Tournament, along with the Fr. Mathew Vas Excellence in Sports Awards 2023 for the parishes of Mangalore and Udupi dioceses, was organized to commemorate the second death anniversary of Rev. Fr. Mathew Vas, a beloved and dynamic senior priest of the Mangalore diocese on Sunday, October 22, 2023, at St Aloysius PU College Ground.

Community Empowerment Trust® Mangalore, a unique voluntary organization, that assists the community by facilitating access to various government and non-government schemes, projects, scholarships, and more for those in need or facing financial hardships, was established in 2016 by a group of dedicated persons, and the late Rev. Fr. Mathew Vas took the initiative to conduct the event. The Trust, in collaboration with the Christian Sports Association Mangalore, Catholic Sabha Mangalore Pradesh®, and Catholic Sabha Udupi Pradesh®, organized this mega event. It witnessed the participation of 30 football teams and 17 throw-ball teams from Mangalore and Udupi dioceses.

The day commenced with a Holy Eucharistic Mass at 7:00 a.m., paying tribute to Fr. Mathew Vas’s memory and his contribution to the community.

The official inauguration of the tournament took place at 10:00 a.m., with the Most Rev. Dr. Aloysius Paul D’Souza, the Bishop Emeritus of Mangalore Diocese, serving as the inaugurator. Mr. Rohan Monteiro, Managing Director of Rohan Corporation Mangalore, graced the event as the chief guest, while Mr. Pradeep D’Souza, secretary of the Coastal Development Authority, and Mr. Melwin Vas, Principal of Milagres PU College Mangalore, and the brother of the late Fr. Mathew Vas, were the Guests of honor.

The symbolic lighting of the lamp and the showering of flower petals on the portrait of Fr. Mathew Vas marked this reverence and respect for his memory.

Mr. Anil Lobo, convener of the event and founder trustee of CET, extended a warm welcome to the dignitaries by presenting them with a bouquet of flowers.

The highlight of the event was the felicitation of 15 budding sportspersons from both dioceses who had achieved success in state-level, national-level, and international-level sporting events. They were honored with shawls, bouquets, mementos, and a cash prize of Rs. 5000 each. Bishop Aloysius Paul D’Souza congratulated all the achievers and offered words of encouragement. He emphasized the importance of their role as role models for other youth. Mr. Rohan Monteiro appreciated the hard work of the organizers. He also congratulated the achievers and promised his support for such events in the future.

The following are the achievers:

Nishanth D’Souza (Piusnagar Parish): Chess

Chris Anjen Baptist (Urwa Parish): badminton

Rianna Dhriti Fernandes (Urwa Parish): Swimming

Vian Thomas Mascarenhus (Udupi Parish): Table Tennis

Dashiel Amanda Concessao (Derebail Parish): Roller Skating

Jesnia Correa (Bejai Parish): Roller Skating

Reema D’Souza (Moodubelle Parish): Boxing

Joylin Natalian D’Souza (Kemmannu Parish): Boxing

Tanisha Malina Crasto (Milagres, Kallianpur Parish): volleyball

Flavisha Velisha Monteiro (Ranipura Parish): Athletics

Delisha Miranda (Moodbidri Parish): Football

Shaun Elroy Fernandes (Udupi Parish): Volleyball

Vipin D’Souza (Saverapura Parish): Hockey

Ashline D’Souza (Udupi Parish): Football

Oswin Joshua Dmello (Piusnagar Parish): Chess

The entire day was marked by exhilarating football and throw-ball matches as the tournament reached its exciting culmination.

The valedictory ceremony held at 6 p.m. was a grand affair with distinguished guests and enthusiastic participants. The event was graced by Rev. Fr. Melwin Pinto, the rector of St. Aloysius institutions, as Chief Guest, Mr. Santhosh Sequeira, proprietor of Santhosh Arrangers, and Ms. Nishel D’Souza, a national-level sportsperson, as guests of honor.

Fr. Melwin Pinto paid a heartfelt tribute to Fr. Mathew Vas. He encouraged the young athletes to excel both in their studies and sports. Ms Nishel was felicitated for her outstanding achievements in sports. The valedictory ceremony was marked by the distribution of awards, cash prizes, and trophies.

Fr. Victor D’Souza, Parish Priest of Sullia Church, Mrs. Celestine D’Souza, president of CET, Mr. John Pais, president of CSA, Mr. Alwyn D’Souza, president of CSMP, Mr. Santhosh Cornelio, president of CSUP, Mr. Lawrence Crasta, secretary of CSA, Mr. Arun Baptist, sports coordinator, were also present during the event.

The entire program was skillfully hosted by Mr. Melwin Peris, while Mr. Patrick kept matches lively with his running commentary.

The Fr. Mathew Vas Memorial Tournament and Excellence Awards 2023 was memorable events that not only celebrated sports but also paid tribute to the legacy of a beloved priest. It brought together the communities of Mangalore and Udupi dioceses in a spirit of camaraderie and athletic competition while honoring the achievements of young sports talents. The event was a fitting tribute to the memory of Rev. Fr. Mathew Vas and his contribution to society.

Results:

Football: Winners—Kulshekhar Parish

Runners, Bajjodi Parish

Semi-finalists: Bela and Kasaragod Parishes

Throw-Ball: Winners: Shirthady Parish

Runners: Madanthyar Parish

Semi-finalists: Vamanjoor and Bondel Parishes

Prizes: Each winning team was awarded certificates, medals, trophies, and a cash prize of Rs. 25,000.

Each runner-up team was awarded certificates, medals, trophies, and a cash prize of Rs. 15000.

Each semi-finalist was awarded trophies and a cash prize of Rs. 7500.
